user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SelectSingle_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_SelectSingle_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, uint32 *SelectFlags, int32 msecs)
{
    int32                           return_code;
    fd_set                          wr_set;
    fd_set                          rd_set;
    OS_impl_file_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_filehandle_table, *token);

    /*
     * If called on a stream_id which does not support this
     * operation, return immediately and do not invoke the system call
     */
    if (!impl->selectable)
    {
        return OS_ERR_OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED;
    }

    if (impl->fd >= FD_SETSIZE)
    {
        /* out of range of select() implementation */
        return OS_ERR_OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED;
    }

    if (*SelectFlags != 0)
    {
        FD_ZERO(&wr_set);
        FD_ZERO(&rd_set);
        if (*SelectFlags & OS_STREAM_STATE_READABLE)
        {
            FD_SET(impl->fd, &rd_set);
        }
        if (*SelectFlags & OS_STREAM_STATE_WRITABLE)
        {
            FD_SET(impl->fd, &wr_set);
        }

        return_code = OS_DoSelect(impl->fd, &rd_set, &wr_set, msecs);

        if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
        {
            if (!FD_ISSET(impl->fd, &rd_set))
            {
                *SelectFlags &= ~OS_STREAM_STATE_READABLE;
            }
            if (!FD_ISSET(impl->fd, &wr_set))
            {
                *SelectFlags &= ~OS_STREAM_STATE_WRITABLE;
            }
        }
        else
        {
            *SelectFlags = 0;
        }
    }
    else
    {
        /* Nothing to check for, return immediately. */
        return_code = OS_SUCCESS;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_SelectSingle_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_impl_file_internal_record_t OS_impl_filehandle_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES]
...
typedef struct
{
    int  fd;
    bool selectable;
} OS_impl_file_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
typedef int32_t   int32
...
typedef uint32_t  uint32
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
static int32 OS_DoSelect(int maxfd, fd_set *rd_set, fd_set *wr_set, int32 msecs)
{
    int             os_status;
    int32           return_code;
    struct timeval  tv;
    struct timeval *tvptr;
    struct timespec ts_now;
    struct timespec ts_end;

    if (msecs > 0)
    {
        clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &ts_now);
        ts_end.tv_sec  = ts_now.tv_sec + (msecs / 1000);
        ts_end.tv_nsec = ts_now.tv_nsec + (1000000 * (msecs % 1000));
        if (ts_end.tv_nsec >= 1000000000)
        {
            ++ts_end.tv_sec;
            ts_end.tv_nsec -= 1000000000;
        }
    }
    else
    {
        /* Zero for consistency and to avoid possible confusion if not cleared */
        memset(&ts_end, 0, sizeof(ts_end));
    }

    do
    {
        if (msecs < 0)
        {
            tvptr = NULL;
        }
        else if (msecs == 0)
        {
            tvptr      = &tv;
            tv.tv_sec  = 0;
            tv.tv_usec = 0;
        }
        else
        {
            tvptr = &tv;

            clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &ts_now);

            /* note that the tv_sec and tv_usec/tv_nsec values are all signed longs, so OK to subtract */
            tv.tv_sec  = ts_end.tv_sec - ts_now.tv_sec;
            tv.tv_usec = (ts_end.tv_nsec - ts_now.tv_nsec) / 1000;

            if (tv.tv_sec < 0 || (tv.tv_sec == 0 && tv.tv_usec < 0))
            {
                os_status = 0;
                break;
            }

            if (tv.tv_usec < 0)
            {
                tv.tv_usec += 1000000;
                --tv.tv_sec;
            }
        }

        os_status = select(maxfd + 1, rd_set, wr_set, NULL, tvptr);
    } while (os_status < 0 && (errno == EINTR || errno == EAGAIN));

    if (os_status < 0)
    {
        return_code = OS_ERROR;
    }
    else if (os_status == 0)
    {
        return_code = OS_ERROR_TIMEOUT;
    }
    else
    {
        return_code = OS_SUCCESS;
    }

    return return_code;
}
...
#define OS_ERR_OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED (-38)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No compiler-specific language extensions are used in the provided code. Specifically:
- There are no uses of compiler extension keywords or constructs such as __attribute__, __extension__, __builtin_*, __asm, typeof, __declspec, Microsoft-specific keywords, or inline assembler.
- The use of static inline is standard C (C99 and later) and is not a compiler-specific extension.
- Fixed-width integer types (int32_t, uint32_t) are standard (C99) typedefs from stdint.h, not extensions.
- FD_SET/FD_ZERO/FD_ISSET, select(), clock_gettime(), struct timeval/struct timespec, and errno/EINTR/EAGAIN are POSIX API features (library/OS interfaces), not compiler language extensions; the Rule 1.2 check as requested is limited to compiler language extensions explicitly documented by compilers.
- The OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET macro uses standard preprocessor and address-of operations; this is standard C macro usage, not an extension.

Because none of the above are compiler-documented language extensions, there are no fragments to flag for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 under the criterion given.
